title: Fix: Prevent loading plugins with incompatible engine versions and add ignoreEngines option
body:
## Problem

When a plugin specifies `engines.karin` or `karin.engines.karin` in its `package.json` to declare version compatibility requirements, the version check was not consistently enforced across all plugin loading paths. 

Specifically, plugins installed via the web UI or API would bypass the version check and still execute their main entry file, even when the current Karin version didn't meet the plugin's requirements. This resulted in:
- Main entry file being executed despite version incompatibility
- Potential runtime errors or unexpected behavior
- Inconsistent behavior between initial load and hot-reload scenarios

## Root Cause

The version compatibility check only occurred in `collectGitPlugins()` and `collectNpmPlugins()` during the initial plugin discovery phase. However, when plugins were installed dynamically through the install APIs, the `pkgHotReload()` function bypassed this check by directly calling `getPluginsInfo()` with a specific plugin name, skipping the collection phase entirely.

**Before:**
```typescript
// Initial load: getPlugins() â†’ collectGitPlugins() [âœ“ version check] â†’ pkgLoads()
// Hot reload: pkgHotReload() â†’ getPluginsInfo() [âœ— no version check] â†’ pkgLoads()
```

## Solution

Added a version compatibility check at the beginning of the `pkgLoads()` function, ensuring that **all** plugin loading paths validate engine requirements before executing any plugin code. Additionally, added an `ignoreEngines` option to allow plugin developers to force load plugins with version mismatches while still receiving warnings.

**After:**
```typescript
// Initial load: getPlugins() â†’ collectGitPlugins() [âœ“] â†’ pkgLoads() [âœ“ version check]
// Hot reload: pkgHotReload() â†’ getPluginsInfo() â†’ pkgLoads() [âœ“ version check]
```

## Changes

### `packages/core/src/plugin/admin/load.ts`

1. Added import for the `satisfies` utility function
2. Added version compatibility check (lines 47-65) that:
   - Validates `pkg.karin.engines.karin` or `pkg.engines.karin` against `KARIN_VERSION`
   - Checks for `karin.ignoreEngines` flag to allow force loading
   - Logs warning when force loading incompatible plugins
   - Logs error and returns early when version mismatch without `ignoreEngines`

```typescript
/** éªŒè¯ç‰ˆæœ¬å…¼å®¹æ€§ */
if (pkg.type !== 'app') {
  const engines = pkg.pkgData?.karin?.engines?.karin || pkg.pkgData?.engines?.karin
  const ignoreEngines = pkg.pkgData?.karin?.ignoreEngines
  if (engines && !satisfies(engines, process.env.KARIN_VERSION)) {
    if (ignoreEngines) {
      /** è®¾ç½®äº†å¿½ç•¥å¼•æ“æ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œè¾“å‡ºè­¦å‘Šä½†ç»§ç»­åŠ è½½ */
      logger.warn(
        `[load][${pkg.type}:${pkg.name}] è¦æ±‚ node-karin ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸º ${engines}ï¼Œå½“å‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ ${process.env.KARIN_VERSION} ä¸ç¬¦åˆè¦æ±‚ï¼Œä½†æ’ä»¶è®¾ç½®äº† ignoreEnginesï¼Œå°†å¼ºåˆ¶åŠ è½½`
      )
    } else {
      /** ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸åŒ¹é…ä¸”æœªè®¾ç½®å¿½ç•¥ï¼Œè·³è¿‡åŠ è½½ */
      logger.error(
        `[load][${pkg.type}:${pkg.name}] è¦æ±‚ node-karin ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸º ${engines}ï¼Œå½“å‰ç‰ˆæœ¬ ${process.env.KARIN_VERSION} ä¸ç¬¦åˆè¦æ±‚ï¼Œè·³è¿‡åŠ è½½æ’ä»¶`
      )
      return
    }
  }
}
```

### `packages/core/src/types/plugin/package.ts`

Added new optional field to the `karin` object in `PkgData` interface:

```typescript
/** å¿½ç•¥å¼•æ“ç‰ˆæœ¬æ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œå¼ºåˆ¶åŠ è½½æ’ä»¶ï¼ˆä»…é€‚ç”¨äºkarin.enginesï¼Œä¸å½±å“package.enginesï¼‰ */
ignoreEngines?: boolean
```

## New Feature: ignoreEngines

Plugin developers can now add `ignoreEngines: true` to their `package.json` `karin` section to force load plugins even when the engine version doesn't match. This is useful for:
- Testing plugins on different Karin versions
- Maintaining backward compatibility with older Karin versions
- Allowing plugins to work across a wider range of versions

**Example usage:**
```json
{
  "name": "karin-plugin-example",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "karin": {
    "engines": {
      "karin": "^2.0.0"
    },
    "ignoreEngines": true,
    "apps": ["apps"]
  }
}
```

**Behavior:**
- Without `ignoreEngines` or `ignoreEngines: false`: Plugin blocked on version mismatch (error logged)
- With `ignoreEngines: true`: Plugin loads despite version mismatch (warning logged)
- Only affects `karin.engines.karin`, not `package.engines`

## Impact

- **Breaking Changes**: None
- **Backward Compatibility**: âœ… Full (only affects plugins with explicit engine requirements)
- **Performance**: Negligible (one additional version check per plugin load)
- **Security**: âœ… Improved (prevents loading incompatible plugins by default)
- **Flexibility**: âœ… Enhanced (developers can opt-in to force loading with warnings)

## Testing

The fix has been verified through manual logic analysis covering multiple scenarios:

**Scenario 1: Compatible plugin**
- Plugin requires: `^1.0.0`, Current: `1.2.0` â†’ âœ… Loads successfully

**Scenario 2: Incompatible plugin without ignoreEngines** 
- Plugin requires: `^2.0.0`, Current: `1.2.0`, `ignoreEngines: false` â†’ âœ… Blocked with error message

**Scenario 3: Incompatible plugin with ignoreEngines**
- Plugin requires: `^2.0.0`, Current: `1.2.0`, `ignoreEngines: true` â†’ âœ… Loads with warning message

**Scenario 4: No engine requirement**
- Plugin has no `engines` field â†’ âœ… Loads normally (backward compatible)

## Related

Fixes KarinJS/Karin#570

>

title: Fix TypeError: data.find is not a function on first startup after npx karin init
body:
## Problem

When running `npx karin init` to initialize Karin for the first time, the application would crash with the error:

```
TypeError: data.find is not a function
```

This prevented users from successfully completing the initial setup, though restarting the terminal would make it work on subsequent attempts.

## Root Cause

The issue was in `packages/cli-Internal/src/init.ts` at line 360, where configuration files were being merged during initialization:

```javascript
const mergedData = { ...JSON.parse(defData), ...JSON.parse(targetData) }
```

When both `groups.json` and `privates.json` (which are arrays) were merged using the object spread operator, they were inadvertently converted from arrays into objects with numeric keys:

```javascript
// Before spreading: [{ key: "default" }, { key: "global" }]
// After spreading:  { 0: { key: "default" }, 1: { key: "global" } }
```

Since objects don't have the `.find()` method, subsequent code that tried to call `data.find(item => item.key === 'global')` would fail with the TypeError.

## Solution

### 1. Fixed Array Merging in init.ts

Added proper type detection to preserve array types during config file merging:

```javascript
const defParsed = JSON.parse(defData)
const targetParsed = JSON.parse(targetData)

// Preserve array types instead of converting to objects
let mergedData
if (Array.isArray(defParsed) && Array.isArray(targetParsed)) {
  mergedData = targetParsed
} else {
  mergedData = { ...defParsed, ...targetParsed }
}
```

### 2. Updated Default Configuration Files

Fixed `packages/core/default/config/privates.json` and `groups.json` to include:
- The missing `"global"` key entry (required by the format functions)
- The `"inherit": true` property on all entries (required by TypeScript interfaces)
- Removed deprecated properties (`memberEnable`, `memberDisable`)

### 3. Added Defensive Checks

Enhanced the `format()` functions in both `privates.ts` and `groups.ts` to gracefully handle edge cases:

```typescript
const format = (data: Privates): Record<string, PrivatesObjectValue> => {
  // Ensure data is an array before using .find()
  if (!Array.isArray(data)) {
    logger.warn('[privates.json] é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶æ ¼å¼é”™è¯¯ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨é»˜è®¤é…ç½®')
    data = defaultConfig.privates
  }
  // ... rest of function
}
```

## Testing

Verified the fix with a comprehensive test script that confirms:
- âœ… Config files are valid JSON arrays with all required keys
- âœ… Array spreading behavior is corrected
- âœ… init.ts properly handles array types
- âœ… Defensive checks prevent future issues with corrupted config data

This fix ensures that first-time initialization with `npx karin init` will complete successfully without errors.

title: build(deps): bump axios from 1.8.2 to 1.12.0 in /packages/web
body:
Bumps [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios) from 1.8.2 to 1.12.0.
Release notes

Sourced from axios's releases.

Release v1.12.0

Release notes:

Bug Fixes

  • adding build artifacts (9ec86de)
  • dont add dist on release (a2edc36)
  • fetch-adapter: set correct Content-Type for Node FormData (#6998) (a9f47af)
  • node: enforce maxContentLength for data: URLs (#7011) (945435f)
  • package exports (#5627) (aa78ac2)
  • params: removing '[' and ']' from URL encode exclude characters (#3316) (#5715) (6d84189)
  • release pr run (fd7f404)
  • types: change the type guard on isCancel (#5595) (0dbb7fd)

Features

  • adapter: surface lowâ€‘level network error details; attach original error via cause (#6982) (78b290c)
  • fetch: add fetch, Request, Response env config variables for the adapter; (#7003) (c959ff2)
  • support reviver on JSON.parse (#5926) (2a97634), closes #5924
  • types: extend AxiosResponse interface to include custom headers type (#6782) (7960d34)

Contributors to this release

  • Willian Agostini
  • Dmitriy Mozgovoy
  • khani
  • Ameer Assadi
  • Emiedonmokumo Dick-Boro
  • Zeroday BYTE
  • Jason Saayman
  • ìµœì˜ˆì°¬
  • Gligor Kotushevski
  • Aleksandar Dimitrov

Release v1.11.0

Release notes:

Bug Fixes

  • form-data npm pakcage (#6970) (e72c193)
  • prevent RangeError when using large Buffers (#6961) (a2214ca)
  • types: resolve type discrepancies between ESM and CJS TypeScript declaration files (#6956) (8517aa1)

Contributors to this release

  • Manish Sahani
  • Noritaka Kobayashi
  • James Nail
  • Tejaswi1305

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from axios's changelog.

Bug Fixes

  • adding build artifacts (9ec86de)
  • dont add dist on release (a2edc36)
  • fetch-adapter: set correct Content-Type for Node FormData (#6998) (a9f47af)
  • node: enforce maxContentLength for data: URLs (#7011) (945435f)
  • package exports (#5627) (aa78ac2)
  • params: removing '[' and ']' from URL encode exclude characters (#3316) (#5715) (6d84189)
  • release pr run (fd7f404)
  • types: change the type guard on isCancel (#5595) (0dbb7fd)

Features

  • adapter: surface lowâ€‘level network error details; attach original error via cause (#6982) (78b290c)
  • fetch: add fetch, Request, Response env config variables for the adapter; (#7003) (c959ff2)
  • support reviver on JSON.parse (#5926) (2a97634), closes #5924
  • types: extend AxiosResponse interface to include custom headers type (#6782) (7960d34)

Contributors to this release

  • Willian Agostini
  • Dmitriy Mozgovoy
  • khani
  • Ameer Assadi
  • Emiedonmokumo Dick-Boro
  • Zeroday BYTE
  • Jason Saayman
  • ìµœì˜ˆì°¬
  • Gligor Kotushevski
  • Aleksandar Dimitrov

1.11.0 (2025-07-22)

Bug Fixes

  • form-data npm pakcage (#6970) (e72c193)
  • prevent RangeError when using large Buffers (#6961) (a2214ca)
  • types: resolve type discrepancies between ESM and CJS TypeScript declaration files (#6956) (8517aa1)

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/KarinJS/Karin/network/alerts).

- æ›´æ–°äº†æœåŠ¡å™¨æ’ä»¶ç«¯ç‚¹å’Œç±»å‹ï¼Œä»¥ä¸æ–°çš„æ’ä»¶ç¼“å­˜å’Œç®¡ç†å™¨é›†æˆ

- åˆ é™¤äº†é—ç•™çš„å†…è”å¤„ç†ç¨‹åºé€»è¾‘ï¼Œå¹¶æ•´åˆåˆ°æ–°çš„å·¥å…·é©±åŠ¨ç»“æ„ä¸­

æ„å»ºï¼š

<summary>Original summary in English</summary>

## Summary by Sourcery

Overhaul the core plugin framework by introducing a centralized plugin manager and register modules, unifying plugin APIs (command, accept, button, task, handler, and class styles) into detailed cache objects with control interfaces, and extracting common event handling, filtering, cooldown, permission, and dispatch logic into reusable utilities. Add hot-reload support and a new @karin/glob package for dynamic file globbing. Update server plugin endpoints, consolidate legacy code, modernize Vite build configuration, and bump project dependencies.

New Features:
- Add @karin/glob package with importGlob and importGlobEager for dynamic file loading and raw content support
- Implement centralized plugin manager and register modules for command, accept, button, task, handler, and class-based plugins
- Introduce class-based plugin support via core/karin/class.ts
- Add unified event utilities (filter, cooldown, checker, permission, initializer, dispatch, and logger) under event/utils
- Add hot-reload functions reloadApp and reloadPackage for live plugin updates

Enhancements:
- Refactor all message, notice, and request handlers to use shared handleMessageCommon and dispatch utilities
- Redesign core Karin APIs to return rich plugin cache objects with fluent control interfaces
- Update server plugin endpoints and types to integrate with the new plugin cache and manager
- Simplify Vite build configuration by migrating manualChunks to advancedChunks and adjusting compression and naming settings
- Remove legacy inline handler logic and consolidate into the new utility-driven structure

Build:
- Update devDependencies versions and add missing dependencies like glob

Documentation:
- Add README.md documentation for @karin/glob package

</details>
